一個永遠免費自由，隨時隨地都可以玩的遊戲！
Welcome to the Game of Democratic World!
A game that is forever free and playable anytime anywhere!

Game Rules of Democratic World
民主世界的遊戲規則
1. 自衛無罪。You may defend yourself.
2. 交流無罪。You may exchange ideas and make friends.
3. 團結無罪。You may join forces and form allies.
4. 等值索償無罪。You may seek compensation of equal worth.
5. 等效還擊無罪。You may retaliate to cause an equal effect.
6. 等域鬥爭無罪。You may compete in the same arena.
7. 漠視逆民之法無罪。You may ignoring a law that opposes the people.
8. 阻止逆民之舉無罪。You may stop an act that opposes the people.
9. 瓦解逆民之權無罪。You may dissolve a power that opposes the people.

當你做合符以上任何原則的事，民主世界不會怪罪於你。但是如果你的辯解牽強，世界便會怪罪於你。If your action can be justified by any of the rules above, Democratic World will not find you guilty. However, insufficient justification would make the World find you guilty.

如果你在不知道民意之時就依照原則7,8,9 行事，你會有做錯事的風險。If you act according to Rule 7,8,9 without knowing the public opinion, you are at risk of acting wrongly.

知道遊戲規則是甚麼，祝你們盡情地玩！
Now you know the game rules, Happy Gaming!

甚麼是「搞獨立」？
民主世界遊戲每個玩者與生俱來就有獨立自由。人人自由交流團結。所謂「搞獨立」不是分離，是凝聚人人個人的心願為一個共有的心願。所以「搞獨立」其實是「搞聯盟」。玩者自由組織聯盟是正常玩法。一直都是，永遠都是。

What is “independence movement”?
In the game of Democratic World, every player is born free and independent. Everyone is free to make friends and form alliances. What people called “independence movement” is not a process of separation, but congregation, a result of players joining their individual wishes into a common wish. Hence, an“independence movement” is actually an “alliance movement”. Freely forming alliance is the normal way to play the game. It has always been like this, and it will always be like this.

個體和民主政府的分別

民主政府的存在完全基於市民對政府的信任。一個市民在未有證據證明有罪的時候都是無辜的，但是一個政府在未有證據證明無辜的時候就是有罪。當市民懷疑政府有罪時，市民就可以開始瓦解政府，因為市民原本就有權隨時隨意瓦解自己的政府。政府不想被瓦解就要趕着調查自己，告訴市民政府還有甚麼可以原諒的地方。一個牽制着市民，不讓市民隨時撤回支持的政府，是一個有缺陷的設計。

The difference between a citizen and its government

A democratic government exists solely based on the trust of its citizens. An individual citizen is innocent until proven guilty, but a government is guilty until proven innocent. When the citizen suspects their government of wrongdoing, they may abolish its government as they have the rights to do so at any time for any reason. If the government does not want to be abolished, it should race against its citizens to investigate itself to regain their trust, to show its citizen what part of the government is redeemable. A government that controls its citizens and keeps them from abolishing it at will, is a flawed design.

✌ = 和平理念

和平理想唔可以打敗武力優勢，但係可以化敵人為友。當朋友們各展所長就可以令武力優勢孤立無援。武力都要食飯要休息。車都要入油，機械人都要充電維修,。出揼嘅除非是十項全能，自給自足，就要靠其他人。

Rock-paper-scissors
✊ = Advantages in Force
✌ = Peaceful Ideals
✋ = Unity and Friendship

Peaceful ideals cannot overcome advantages in force, but they can make friends and turn enemies into allies. When one's allies do what they do best, they can isolate those relying only on their forces. People using forces still need to eat and rest. Vehicles still need fuel. Drones and robots still need to be recharged and repaired. Unless those people using force are self-sufficient, they need support from those without force.

Force can be overcome by force, but the premise is whether one is a rock or a pair of scissors. Having enough scissors can destroy a rock too, but a rock is most easily defeated by paper. Scissors are better at making paper than breaking rocks.

As scissors make new friends, they will realize that some of their new friends are not scissors, but paper.

The difference between retaliation and attack
還擊和攻擊的分別
5. 等效還擊無罪。You may retaliate to cause an equal effect.
9. 瓦解逆民之權無罪。You may dissolve a power that opposes the people.

第五條是指當一個人攻擊﹐其他人不論是否有自己衛的需要﹐都可以還擊。第九條是指當一個政權逆民時﹐市民可以用任何方法攻擊直至持權人棄權。在第九條中﹐武力不限於還擊。市民可以自由主動攻擊政權。

所謂「攻擊政權」的意思不一定是殺傷﹐因為政權不是一個人。政權是一種指揮鏈的關係。每個為政權做事的人都是這個鎖鏈的其中一環。每一個環不再為政權做事﹐就是放棄了權﹐不再是政權的一部份。

According to Rule 6, when an individual attacks, the other may retaliate regardless whether they act out of self-defense. According to Rule 9, the people can attack those who use the government against its own people until they abandon their powers. The use of force in Rule 9 allows initiating any attack.

Attacking the power of the government does not necessarily mean causing harm to individual government officials. The government is not a person but a command chain. Everyone who works for the government is a link in that chain. A person abandons their government power when they give up working for the government.

藍天使的公義筆記
民主與法治

在民主社會，人民定下法律作為人與人之間明文章的協議。但是法律本身只是在近似公義的表達，而不是公義的本質。當法律不能完全表達公義的時候，從法律可達成的公義，和從良知可以達成的公義就有差別。這個差別就是法律的不足，也可以是法律的漏洞，和人民對法律的失望。但是在民主社會裏，人民是可以修改法律，減少這個差異。

法治量度社會執行公義的穩定性和可知性。在一個高度法治的社會中，人民可以預知自己的作為是否犯法和後果是甚麼。但是在良知的眼中，法律不只是「遊戲規則」，不可以用合法的手段來欺凌他人。要判斷當是人有沒有用合法的手段來欺凌他人，就要動用人民的良知。所以，為了補足法律的不足，民主的憲法可以包括有人民直接定罪和直接赦免的權力，令無人可以利用法律來欺凌他人而不受公義影響。

為了建立法治，人民可以明文解釋直接判決，再加入法例中，確認法律是表達公義的工具，但永遠不是約束公義的枷鎖。良知是可以凌駕明文的法例來作出判決。在民主社會中，這個權不是在領袖或大法官的手中，而是在人民的手中。所以，可以說民主的法治，是可以由人民即時修補的法治。

Blue Angel’s Notes on Justice
On Democracy and Rule of the Laws

In a democratic society, the laws serve as a written agreement among its people. However, the laws is just an expression of justice, not justice itself. When the laws does not fully express justice, a difference exists between the justice served by the laws and the justice that should be served according to conscience. This difference is the deficiency of the laws, the potholes of the laws, and the people’s disappointment in the laws. Yet, in a democratic society, the people may amend the laws to reduce such difference.

Rule of Laws measures the stability and predictability of justice in a society. In a society that subscribes highly to Rule of Laws, the people can predict the culpability and consequences of their actions. However, in the eye of conscience, the laws is not just a set of “Game Rules”. The laws is not meant to be exploited to cause harm. To judge whether the laws have been exploited to do so requires the conscience of the people. Therefore, to amend the deficiencies of the laws, a democratic constitution may include the rights of the people to directly sentence and to directly pardon, such that no person may exploit the laws to cause harm without a just consequence.

To establish Rule of Laws, the people may explain and codify their direct judgment into the laws, confirming that the laws is a tool for expressing justice, never the shackles that restricts justice. A verdict based on conscience may override a verdict based on the written laws. In a democratic society, such rights lie not in the hands of its leader or its judges, but in the hands of the people. Therefore, a Democratic Rule of laws can be said to be a Rule of Laws that can be immediately repaired by the people.
